channel.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
channel.description:
[center][img]http://img854.imageshack.us/img854/1373/wikic.png[/img][/center]
[u]News:[/u] [quote="Moparisthebest"]This is back online, and hosted on my server so it shouldn't go down anymore, it's also being backed up regularly to multiple locations (once a week). It's still at the same URL and everything else should remain the same. T4_ is still in charge of everything with regard to running it, user accounts, and the like.[/quote]
[u]Intro:[/u] In regards to [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,497218.0.html]this topic[/url], I am now releasing the wiki to the public. Captcha has been added to the wiki to prevent abuse; and of course, backups have been made of the database. Currently, the majority of the information covered is based on the [b]#317[/b] Protocol, [b]JAGGRAB[/b] Protocol, [b]Ondemand[/b] Protocol, [b]Cache Archive Format[/b], [b]RS Data Types[/b], and [b]#202[/b] Protocol. The format of the wiki is fairly laid out, so it will be quite easy to expand on certain topics. If anyone has any information on the other commonly used client revisions (or perhaps a new one) feel free to contribute.
[u]Simple Rules:[/u]
[ul][li]Vandalism: Obviously, we do not allow vandalism of any kind - users (or IP Addresses) found in violation of this rule will find them self with a nice IP ban.[/li]
[li]Advertising: Attempting to advertise other sites outside of the wiki that do not provide educational benefits is strictly prohibited.[/li]
[li]Download Links/Uploads: Any link or upload that contains copywrited material (ex: a client revision or cache archive) is strictly prohibited and will be removed along with a punishment for the user; this is your only warning.[/li]
[li]Posting Unreliable Information: The wiki is an education resource, so posting misinformed information is not optimal for learning - please avoid this.[/li][/ul]
[u]Miscellaneous Information:[/u] Feel free to ask any questions here or request information. If you wish to provide a mirror for this wiki (and are deemed capable), it will be discussed as a possibility. Most of the information on the wiki has been pulled from: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=23929]blakeman8192[/url], [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=13264]samuraiblood2[/url], [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=22632]Graham[/url], and [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=352171]super_[/url] to name a few - so be sure to thank them in their efforts!
For a nice looking signature to spread the word, use: [code][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,498106.0.html]RSWiki: RS Server/Client Documentation Resource[/url][/code]
So, without further stalling: [u]Link:[/u] http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/
[u]Side Note:[/u] [s]Would a moderator be kind and un-sticky [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,497218.0.html]this topic[/url] and sticky this one?[/s]

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)

@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Not me actually editing the 443 protocol, I’ve only edited 317, but discussing stuff about 443 over Skype with sini. therefore, helping!

Read full topic

item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

AtomicInt_:

check out 443 sini and i have been working on that. (Possibly others? I don’t know)

Are you sure you hit save when you modified a page because the only edits I’ve seen are for the player head on interface and some edits you did to the 317 protocol.

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:20, topic:401051”]I edit occasionally.

Bump. We could use more people being interested in this.

You can’t bump a stickied topic. :P[/quote]

You say that as if you’ve been contributing for a long time.

But to stay on topic with things, it would be great if others could help document the protocol and such. Something great would be getting packets for other revisions or even something new that no one else knows!

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Supah Flyizzle, post:17, topic:401051”][quote author=t4 link=topic=498106.msg3706389#msg3706389 date=1313069645]

Hey T4, I may start adding some stuff to this if you don’t mind.

Of course I don’t mind, it’s public for the reason of public (yet controlled) contributions!
[/quote]

We need more/more clear rules.

No edits with unclear explanations or bad information.
No server-specific code, only easily interpretable pseudo-code.

That’s just to name a few.

By the way, I added documentation for packets we’ve never really used. Very useful stuff though.

Also:
My undo was called for, correct?[/quote]

Yes, you’re in the right.

Updated:
http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=Rules

Read full topic
item.source: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
item.dc:creator: @synchronized2 synchronized_
item.description:
@synchronized2 wrote:

I don’t know if this is going to be any use to anyone - but I dumped everything about the index files. I was going to add them to the Wiki but there was too much text.

The file includes:

[ul][li](The actual index file itself)[/li]
[li]The File Size[/li]
[li]The number of files it points to within the actual data file.[/li]
[li]The raw data. EG: [34, 24, 25, 35, 65, 23, …, 43][/li]
[li](The files the index files point to)[/li]
[li]The File Size[/li]
[li]The Initial Data Block Id[/li][/ul]

((LINK: INDEX_FILE_DUMP.txt (2.2MB)))

About the website: It’s cool. I’ll be happy to contribute once I’ve learned some more about the protocol etc.

Read full topic
item.source: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:401051”]You already don’t allow anonymous to edit right? I could figure out the rest I’m sure, do you want me to host a mirror that way?

If so, bandwidth/speed wise it would probably be best for you to have a non-compressed .sql dump on your server I could grab with rsync -az (which gzips it before sending it over the line), that way, since the database won’t change much daily, I’d just be copying the compressed differences over the line, instead of the entire file. You’d just have to add my ssh public key to your authorized_keys files and I could grab it automatically.[/quote]

Editing/Registering rules are done via LocalSettings.php. And sure - that sounds fine.

Read full topic
item.source: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You already don’t allow anonymous to edit right? I could figure out the rest I’m sure, do you want me to host a mirror that way?

If so, bandwidth/speed wise it would probably be best for you to have a non-compressed .sql dump on your server I could grab with rsync -az (which gzips it before sending it over the line), that way, since the database won’t change much daily, I’d just be copying the compressed differences over the line, instead of the entire file. You’d just have to add my ssh public key to your authorized_keys files and I could grab it automatically.

Read full topic
item.source: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)

Moparisthebest:

Is it possible/easy to set mediawiki to un-editable? As long as I could do it programmatically it wouldn’t be a big deal.

Don’t allow new users to register, and don’t allow anon to edit

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:401051”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=498106.msg3643767#msg3643767 date=1309213317]
As for mirror, I suppose a site that would grab the sql database gzipped daily by scp and write the changes to the database on the mirror. Of course, that means the mirror would have to be static (un-editable).
[/quote]

Would it really have to be un-editable if the database just gets over-written every night anyway? I could set up a script to do that.[/quote]
Just so people wouldn’t get confused and post new content there.

Read full topic
item.source: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:401051”]I don’t know if you got everything out of the runewiki database already, or still want others to do that, regardless, it is here for anyone that wants it:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/runewiki.truncated_users.sql.bz2
Be warned it’s a pain to set up mediawiki and get it to work with this, only try it if you are ready for that.

Also, what do you mean by hosting a mirror? Depending on how you wanted to handle that, I could probably host one here.[/quote]
I set up the backup of the old wiki over @ archive.gyrat.in (passwd protected directory). Got everything copied over to the new wiki too - take a look.

As for mirror, I suppose a site that would grab the sql database gzipped daily by scp and write the changes to the database on the mirror. Of course, that means the mirror would have to be static (un-editable).

Davidi2:

For a second I was like, “where is the link? ”, then I saw you put it in code tags

An easy URL to remember too!

Read full topic
item.source: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)

@moparisthebest wrote:

https://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/runewiki.truncated_users.sql.bz2
Be warned it’s a pain to set up mediawiki and get it to work with this, only try it if you are ready for that.

item.title: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[center][/center]

News:

Moparisthebest:

This is back online, and hosted on my server so it shouldn’t go down anymore, it’s also being backed up regularly to multiple locations (once a week). It’s still at the same URL and everything else should remain the same. T4_ is still in charge of everything with regard to running it, user accounts, and the like.

Intro:
In regards to this topic, I am now releasing the wiki to the public. Captcha has been added to the wiki to prevent abuse; and of course, backups have been made of the database. Currently, the majority of the information covered is based on the #317 Protocol, JAGGRAB Protocol, Ondemand Protocol, Cache Archive Format, RS Data Types, and #202 Protocol. The format of the wiki is fairly laid out, so it will be quite easy to expand on certain topics. If anyone has any information on the other commonly used client revisions (or perhaps a new one) feel free to contribute.

Simple Rules:

[ul][li]Vandalism: Obviously, we do not allow vandalism of any kind - users (or IP Addresses) found in violation of this rule will find them self with a nice IP ban.[/li]

[li]Advertising: Attempting to advertise other sites outside of the wiki that do not provide educational benefits is strictly prohibited.[/li]

[li]Download Links/Uploads: Any link or upload that contains copywrited material (ex: a client revision or cache archive) is strictly prohibited and will be removed along with a punishment for the user; this is your only warning.[/li]

[li]Posting Unreliable Information: The wiki is an education resource, so posting misinformed information is not optimal for learning - please avoid this.[/li][/ul]

Miscellaneous Information:
Feel free to ask any questions here or request information. If you wish to provide a mirror for this wiki (and are deemed capable), it will be discussed as a possibility. Most of the information on the wiki has been pulled from: blakeman8192, samuraiblood2, Graham, and super_ to name a few - so be sure to thank them in their efforts!

For a nice looking signature to spread the word, use:

So, without further stalling:
Link:
http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/

Side Note:
Would a moderator be kind and un-sticky this topic and sticky this one?

Read full topic
item.source: RSWiki: The RS Server and Client Documentation Resource (BACK ONLINE)
